title: 107_hr542
content:
The Act titled "Small Business Review Panel Technical Amendments Act of 1999" is for the purpose of making technical amendments. The Small Business Review Panel Technical Amendments Act of 1999 aims to enhance small business participation in the federal regulatory process by clarifying and strengthening the Small Business Advocacy Review Panel process and expanding the number of federal agencies required to convene such panels. SEC. 3. ENSURING FULL ANALYSIS OF POTENTIAL IMPACTS ON SMALL ENTITIES OF RULES PROPOSED BY CERTAIN AGENCIES. Section 609(b) of title 5, United States Code, is amended to require covered agencies to notify the Chief Counsel for Advocacy of the Small Business Administration before publishing an initial regulatory flexibility analysis. This includes providing information on potential impacts on small entities and identifying affected small entity representatives for advice and recommendations. The covered agency must identify affected small entity representatives and transmit information to them for obtaining advice on potential impacts of the draft proposed rule. A review panel consisting of federal employees, the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs, and the Chief Counsel will convene to review materials and collect recommendations from the identified small entity representatives. The review panel, consisting of federal employees, the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs, and the Chief Counsel, will review materials prepared by the covered agency, collect advice from small entity representatives, and allow oral presentations. Within 60 days, the panel must report to the agency head on comments received and findings on specific issues. The agency head is required to publish the panel's report in the Federal Register promptly. The review panel, composed of federal employees, the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs, and the Chief Counsel, will assess materials from the covered agency, gather input from small entity representatives, and present oral arguments. Within 60 days, the panel must submit a report to the agency head on received comments and findings on specific issues. The agency head is mandated to publish the panel's report in the Federal Register promptly. Additionally, the head of the covered agency must publish the report of the review panel within 120 days of receiving it, or as part of the notice of proposed rulemaking for the proposed rule. The covered agency should make necessary modifications to the draft proposed rule, the initial regulatory flexibility analysis, or the decision on whether an initial regulatory flexibility analysis is needed. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS.

Section 609(d) of title 5, United States Code, is amended to define 'covered agency' as the Environmental Protection Agency, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration of the Department of Labor, and the Internal Revenue Service of the Department of the Treasury, and 'small entity representative' as a small entity or an individual/organization representing a small entity.

SEC. 5. EFFECTIVE DATE.

This Act will take effect after a 90-day period from its enactment.
